description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Salzburg" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Salzburg

places.generalDescription: Mirabell Palace, a 17th-century architectural gem located in Salzburg, is renowned for its ornamental gardens and opulent interior. The palace was featured in the iconic film 'The Sound of Music,' with its gardens serving as the backdrop for memorable scenes. Built by Archbishop Wolf Dietrich in 1606 and later redesigned in Baroque style, the palace boasts exquisite interior decorations including stucco and wall paintings.

sources.snippet: Another garden used in the filming of The Sound of Music is at Salzburg's lovely Mirabell Palace (Schloss Mirabell). This excellent example of Baroque landscape design was laid out in 1690 with numerous terraces, marble statues, and fountains. The palace itself was remodeled in Baroque style between 1721-27 before being restored in the simpler Neoclassical style after a fire in 1818.
sources.shortName: 18 Top-Rated Things to Do in Salzburg

sources.snippet: Built early in the 17th century by prince-archbishop Wolf Dietrich for his wife, Mirabell Palace and Gardens is one of the most beautiful places in Salzburg. The palace, the manicured gardens, the fountains, the views ‚Äì everything is so beautiful. A visit here is like stepping into a fairytale!
sources.shortName: 17 BEST Places to See & Things to Do in Salzburg, Austria (+Map & Tips)

sources.snippet: End the day with a romantic dinner at Restaurant Ikarus, located at the Red Bull Hangar-7 and featuring innovative cuisine by top chefs from around the world.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

places.name: Mirabell Palace

reviews.text:
Mirabell Palace is absolutely stunning and a must-see in Salzburg. The palace itself is elegant, but the real highlight is the Mirabell Gardens - beautifully maintained with colorful flower beds, sculptures, and fountains that make it feel like you've stepped into a fairytale. The view looking through the gardens towards the fortress is breathtaking and perfect for photos.

It's free to enter the gardens, and they're easy to walk through, so it's a great stop even if you're short on time. If you visit in spring or summer, the flowers are in full bloom and the atmosphere is magical. Music lovers will also appreciate that some of the ‚ÄúSound of Music‚Äù scenes were filmed here.

Highly recommend visiting in the morning before the crowds arrive - it's peaceful, romantic, and unforgettable.

The gardens are magnificent. Symmetry and colors are combined in beautiful compositions. Access to the gardens is free. The palace itself is also free, but there is nothing to see. Access is only to the staircase, which is magnificent, but it is disappointing that there is no access to the halls. We only managed to peek into one.

Mirabell Palace in Salzburg is straight out of a fairytale ‚ú®. The gardens are full of colorful flowers, fountains, and little hidden corners that feel so peaceful. You can wander around, take in the mountain views, and feel like you're in a scene from The Sound of Music. It's charming, romantic, and a must-see if you're in Salzburg üíêüè∞

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hilltop with commanding views of the city and the Alps, Fortress Hohensalzburg is an impressive 11th-century complex that draws in over 1.4 million visitors annually. To avoid the crowds, it's best to arrive early and take a glass funicular or embark on a steep 20-minute walk up Festungsgasse in the Old Town to reach this iconic landmark.

sources.snippet: The spectacular Hohensalzburg Fortress is one of the main landmarks of Salzburg and also the heart of the historic old town. A visit to this stunning place is an absolute highlight and definitely this impressive fortress is one of the most beautiful attractions in Salzburg. The 900-year-old Hohensalzburg Fortress is located at the top of the M√∂nchsberg and can either be climbed on foot, or you can comfortably take the fortress train, which is located next to the Stieglkeller and the Festungsgasse.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Salzburg (Austria)

sources.snippet: Salzburg is dominated by the picturesque Fortress Hohensalzburg (Festung Hohensalzburg), a stunning historic fortress that dominates the city skyline. Situated on the southeastern summit of the M√∂nchsberg, the original castle was built in 1077, and much of what's seen today dates from the early 1500s. You can reach the castle by a pleasant 20-minute walk from the Old Town center or via a funicular railway from Festungsgasse.
sources.shortName: 18 Top-Rated Things to Do in Salzburg

sources.snippet: Even as you enter Salzburg, catching the first glimpse of Hohensalzburg Fortress, you sense it immediately: the magnetism of a proud and fascinating city. On the stages of this City of Mozart Tristan and Isolde have fallen hopelessly in love, while Romeo and Juliet have left the City of Mozart will many a bitter-sweet memory. In other words, Salzburg is the perfect place in which to celebrate love!
sources.shortName: Salzburg for Lovers : Magazine

sources.snippet: Dating back to the 11th century, Hohensalzburg Fortress is one of the largest and best-preserved fortresses in Europe. A key landmark of Salzburg and an integral part of its skyline, the fortress is located high on Festungberg Hill. You can either walk to it or take a funicular from the old town, which is far quicker and much easier.
sources.shortName: 17 BEST Places to See & Things to Do in Salzburg, Austria (+Map & Tips)
Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

sources.siteName: 4* Hotel Wolf-Dietrich in Salzburg, Austria, Old Town
sources.shortName: Romantic hotel Salzburg | romantic city break for 2
Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

places.name: Fortress Hohensalzburg

reviews.text: The outdoors¬†is open for hours after indoor exhibits¬†close in summer. This is the last place on my list for the day. My plan was to visit all the indoor exhibits before closing then enjoy the outdoors hopefully in the cooler hours. It's big and interesting with¬†multiple¬†buildings. High up on the hill, with great views of the city and surrounding¬†areas. One would think this is a great location to defend the city. Ironically, it's not been battle tested after it was built¬†in the 11th century. With the city pass, went up with the cable car and walked down. It would be a good climb to hike up. On a hot summer day, no thanks.

Huge fortress, imposing, impressive build.  The walk up from the town to the highest part of the turret is a workout.  The fortress approach walkway is significantly sloped, covered in fine rock and worn dirt, so wear a good pair of shoes that give good grip.  For anyone with mobility issues or if it's raining/wet, I'd highly recommend the funicular.   While the fortress has an interesting history, I was disappointed that there were not more objects of historical significance inside it.  It's actually pretty sparse inside.  There are some military items, but very few furnishings and no tapestries.  The staff were all very helpful.  The cost of a visit is very reasonable.  The view is unparalleled.  It is truly a commanding view of the surrounding countryside.  Worth doing for the view, but could use more historical/period artifacts inside and around the grounds.

Great view, we took the tram up but I think it would have been lovely to have a hike up. We got the basic card and we were able to finish all attractions well within 3 hours. View from observation deck was amazing.

places.generalDescription: Salzburg Cathedral, with its twin spires and baroque-style architecture, is a monumental symbol of the city's religious significance and historical wealth. The cathedral houses a museum that displays sacred treasures, adding to its allure. The building has undergone several reconstructions over the centuries, with the current structure showcasing early Baroque ecclesiastical architecture at its finest. Visitors are captivated by the towering facade and turquoise domes of this 17th-century marvel.

sources.snippet: A visit to Salzburg Cathedral is certainly one of the things to do in Salzburg because this building is absolutely impressive from the inside as well as from the outside. The imposing church dates back to the early Baroque period and shapes the cityscape of Salzburg with its mighty dome and towers. The cathedral square is also the site of the annual Christmas market in winter and the famous Salzburg Festival in summer.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Salzburg (Austria)

sources.snippet: A prominent building thanks to its twin 79-meter tall towers, Salzburg Cathedral (Salzburger Dom) was completed in 1657 and is famous for its Italian style and its role as the location of Mozart's baptism. The building's west front, facing the Domplatz, has four colossal marble statues, the outer ones representing St. Rupert and Virgil, patron saints of the province. The inner ones depict Peter and Paul.
sources.shortName: 18 Top-Rated Things to Do in Salzburg

sources.snippet: The impressive Cathedral is one of the most notable landmarks in Salzburg. Standing right in the heart of the old town and surrounded by the most beautiful and important town squares, you‚Äôll inevitably pass here at least a few times during your visit. A cathedral was first built on this site in 774.
sources.shortName: 17 BEST Places to See & Things to Do in Salzburg, Austria (+Map & Tips)
Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

places.name: Salzburg Cathedral

reviews.text: Salzburg Cathedral is so big and impressive! You have to get in! We went for the mass and light a candle on Easter Day and the atmosphere was divine and peaceful. The statues and the ceiling are so beautiful and well maintained. It's in the center of Salzburg in the middle of a massive square. Overall amazing to visit and recommend it! There is an entrance fee of 5 euros.

Gorgeous cathedral, but not the best for choir concert. My son sang with a group of over 100 kids and you could barely hear them.

The massive, absolutely stunning interior is just not made for that. Otherwise, it was awesome.

The inside of this cathedral is absolutely stunning. The walls and ceilings are bathed in rich and intricate detail and the ceiling has eye catching murals and statues. It truly is something to see and worth a bit of your time in Salzburg. It doesn't take long to just pop in and admire. I would encourage visitors to wear appropriate clothing and act appropriately considering this is a church.

places.generalDescription: Salzburg Zoo Hellbrunn is a family-friendly destination featuring over 1,500 animals from various continents. Originally established in the 15th century as an archbishopric zoological park, it now showcases 150 different species. The zoo's unique topography, nestled next to a cliff leading to the large African savannah, adds to its charm.

sources.snippet: The Salzburg Hellbrunn Zoo is a real must-see, as it is definitely one of the most beautiful zoos in Austria. A large part was already from the 15th century the archiepiscopal game park, with the zoo today a popular destination for families. Nestled in a gorgeous landscape, this place is home to a variety of interesting animal species on 14 hectares, which are kept in enclosures that are as close to nature as possible.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Salzburg (Austria)
Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

places.name: Salzburg Zoo Hellbrunn

reviews.text: Lovely zoo. The zoo itself is not big, you could explore it all within 3 hours comfortably. Despite that, it hosts some animals you don't see very often and it offers nice viewpoints into all of the enclosures. It was clean, enclosures seem well-thought out, animals look healthy & happy. The zoo utilizes the natural rocky terrain in an interesting way.
Well it was much more then we expected. Good place to pass 3-4 hours with the kids. We gave them the map and follow them.. bring food and water with you and make it a great day!

Animals were very active.
We really enjoyed the time.
With the Salzburg card we can enter the zoo without additional payments.
Car parking is free for those who come to visit the zoo.

Don't forget to punch your car parking ticket before exiting from the Zoo. Else you have to pay parking charges

Pretty good restaurant available inside the zoo

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Salzburg, Zum Zirkelwirt is a charming haunt offering a blend of tradition and quirkiness. The rustic setting with fur-lined seats and wooden decor gives it the feel of a mountain lodge. The menu may be limited, but each dish is freshly prepared and delicious. The waitstaff, dressed in traditional attire, adds to the lively atmosphere by welcoming guests with yodels.

sources.snippet: The Zirkelwirt is a traditional house in a quiet location a little away from the center at Papagenoplatz and belongs to the culinary Salzburg tips in this list.
sources.shortName: Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

places.name: Zum Zirkelwirt

reviews.text:
Excellent restaurant! Nice and cozy place. If you want to have a delicious Austrian food experience, this is the place to go!
Super tasty, home-made food and great service! You enjoy delicious Austrian food together with the kindness and joy of the Austrians.
Sasha, thank you for the great service and the special liqueur!
Simply tasty and wonderful food. Service was great and quick. We ordered, and food came out no more than 10 minutes later. The goulash was tasty, and my partner was impressed with the schnitzel.

Wiener Schnitzel: A Crispy, Golden Delight

I finally tried an authentic Wiener Schnitzel-and wow. It's everything people say it is and more. The veal was perfectly tender, the breading light and crisp without being greasy, and that simple squeeze of lemon brought it all to life. Paired with a warm potato salad and a cold Austrian beer, it was comfort food at its finest. You can tell when a dish has history behind it-and this one tastes like tradition, care, and old-world flavor. Absolutely delicious. A must-try

places.generalDescription: Red Bull Hangar-7 is a futuristic building located next to the main Salzburg Airport. It houses the Flying Bulls display team and features various aeronautical artifacts, including airplanes, motorbikes, rally cars, and Formula 1 exhibits. The hangar also boasts several bars, a cafe, and a Michelin Star restaurant. Its unique architecture with a hydrofoil dome makes it an exciting place to visit.
places.name: Red Bull Hangar-7

reviews.text:
Bucket-list experience ‚Äì highly recommended!

Red Bull Hangar-7 was an unforgettable stop during my trip to Salzburg. The combination of aviation, motorsport, and cutting-edge architecture is unlike anything I've seen before. The displays - from historic planes to Red Bull's Formula 1 beasts - are absolutely stunning. You can really feel the passion for speed, precision, and innovation in every corner of the space.

I've uploaded some photos I took during my visit - but honestly, they don't do it justice. You have to experience it in person to really appreciate the scale and atmosphere.

The best part? Entry is free! There's also a Michelin-star restaurant and a stylish bar inside, which adds to the overall premium feel of the place.

Whether you're a motorsport fan, an aviation enthusiast, or just someone who appreciates world-class design - Hangar-7 is a must-see.

10/10 would visit again.

The building has incredible architecture. Impressive. Admission is free. Inside there is a neat exhibition of contemporary artists, which makes the place even more interesting. We visited it early on Thursday, but unfortunately the planes were taking them out of the hangar to participate in flights and we couldn't look at them. Fortunately, the cars and motors were there and we're able to look at them at least. The fan shop is not very big, but you can find your favorite Red Bull item.

A wonderful museum to visit if you love airplanes and cars for sure!!! The admission is free and you can simply just walk in! The ice cream place near the entrance is also very delicious. And I'd like to mention the best for last in my opinion; the restrooms. PLEASE go visit them, they're absolutely BEAUTIFUL AND VERY SANITARY. It felt like luxury treatment in there haha! I went to this museum with my father, but I would love to visit this place again with my friends next time I travel to Switzerland! ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

places.generalDescription: Hotel Schloss M√∂nchstein is a luxurious boutique hotel located in a 13th-century castle atop Monchstein Hill, offering breathtaking views of Salzburg, including the iconic Mirabell Palace and the majestic Alps. Guests are treated to personalized service and exclusivity, with amenities such as an infinity pool, outdoor hot tub, and welcome drink.

sources.snippet: Romantic hilltop castle in an extensive park and gardens, with fine views over Salzburg. Gourmet dining and a top spa. Rooms are luxuriously finished, with priceless antiques and marble bathrooms.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Salzburg, Austria (2025)

places.name: Hotel Schloss M√∂nchstein

reviews.text: Beautiful rooms and facilities, great location, and impeccable service. What a gem of a place ! It was like a dream. The breakfast included is 10/10 delicious and the restaurant for dinner was possibly a bit experimental for some but still very well done. I hope to be back one day !

We had a really wonderful stay. The hotel is beautiful. The location is really fantastic. The Tower Room was incredibly clean and comfortable. The staff is exceptional, friendly, and very attentive. We would absolutely stay here again without a second thought.

We had the best time staying here. The location is dreamy and the staff treats you like royalty. The hotel sits high up on a hill and provides the most incredible views from the garden. Luckily there is an elevator to take you to the city below.

places.generalDescription: St. Peter's Abbey, situated in Salzburg, Austria, is a renowned Benedictine monastery and Catholic church with a rich history dating back to the 7th century. Established by Saint Rupert, it stands as one of the oldest abbey-church and monastery complexes in the German-speaking world. The Romanesque St. Peter's Church, built in 1143 and later restored with Baroque and Rococo elements, showcases ornate altarpieces by Martin Johann Schmidt.

sources.snippet: Located beside DomQuartier is the Abbey of St. Peter, a Benedictine monastery and former cathedral. You can‚Äôt enter the Abbey itself, although a visit to the interior of its ‚ÄòLong Gallery‚Äô is included as part of the DomQuartier tour. But you might want to stop and take a moment to appreciate the wonderful smell of fresh bread coming from Stiftsb√§ckerei St Peter, Salzburg‚Äôs oldest bakery.
sources.shortName: 17 BEST Places to See & Things to Do in Salzburg, Austria (+Map & Tips)

sources.snippet: On the western side of Salzburg's Kapitelplatz stands the Benedictine Abbey of St. Peter (Erzabtei St. Peter). Founded by St. Rupert in 690 CE, this impressive building complex served as the residence of the Archbishops until 1110. While the present buildings date mainly from the 17th and 18th centuries, they remain an impressive testament to the order's architectural skills.
sources.shortName: 18 Top-Rated Things to Do in Salzburg

places.name: St. Peter's Abbey

reviews.text: The whole area was beautiful. I think I read that the interior of the church is Roccoco style - it was very dark in there. The surrounding of the cemetery and catacomb area offers really picturesque views.  Very historic church that was interesting to research !

St. Peter's Abbey is a breathtaking piece of history nestled in the heart of Salzburg. Dating back to the 7th century, this Catholic church and monastery exude an aura of timeless beauty and serenity. The Baroque architecture, intricate decorations, and peaceful atmosphere make it a must-visit for history lovers and spiritual seekers alike.

One of the highlights is the picturesque cemetery and catacombs, which offer a fascinating glimpse into the past. The surroundings are stunning, with the abbey seamlessly blending into the rocky landscape. Whether you're admiring the Rococo-style interior or exploring the historical graves, every corner of St. Peter's Abbey tells a story.

A visit here is not just about sightseeing-it's an experience that leaves you with a deep appreciation for Salzburg's rich heritage. Highly recommended.

The cemetery was unlike anything that I have seen. Though the sound of music took the look of St. Peter's cemetery it was not filmed here. Still very much worth seeing. Walking around the Abby in the court there are some areas open to enter, however I was not dressed church appropriate to enter so I can't comment on the inside

places.generalDescription: B√§renwirt is a traditional Austrian inn located in Salzburg City, dedicated to preserving the iconic culture and cuisine of the region. The restaurant is renowned for its fried chicken, which is considered the best in Austria, as well as other classics like Salzburger Nockerl. The cozy tavern offers a warm, woody atmosphere reminiscent of a hunting lodge and has been serving traditional dishes since 1663.

sources.snippet: There are a lot of fancy restaurants in Salzburg, with price tags to match, but sometimes all you want is schnitzel as big as a boot, cooked to golden perfection, and a side order of history. You‚Äôll find precisely this at B√§renwirt, a warm, woody, hunting lodge-style tavern that has been juggling the pans since 1663. The inn forgoes all the new-fangled food trends in favor of good old-fashioned, gut-busting dishes like Bierbraten (beer roast) with lashings of dumplings and sauerkraut, beef goulash and Kasnocken (mini cheese dumplings with fried onions).
sources.shortName: The 12 best things to do in Salzburg
Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

places.name: B√§renwirt

reviews.text: A nice, quiet atmosphere. Friendly staff, cold beers and amazing food!  Schnitzel was incredibly tasty. The Fried Chicken was wonderful and the potato salad was superb! 10/10 would definitely eat here again

We stopped by for late lunch and got the spinach dumpling. It was divine!! That, paired with brown butter + cheese - ü§§ so satisfying, even for a meat lover. Aside from that, we had Apple strudel. It was perfectly balance with the cream and somehow tasted very homey. Not too sweet. And of course had beer - which is always nice and refreshing. Wanted to try their fried chicken as I saw many good reviews on it but sadly we were too full. Please do me a favour and try it ok? üòù
Service could be better as no one took our order for quite some time, even though there weren't many customers at that time.

I had been looking forward to this for at least two weeks, and it was exactly what I expected-the fried chicken was SO FREAKING GOOD. The outside was perfectly fried, and the tender, juicy meat was just right. They even served a sour potato salad on the side. This was the first time I'd ever finished an entire potato salad; it was really good. I managed to finish both the chicken and the salad, even though the portion was huge for me.

places.generalDescription: The DomQuartier Salzburg is a UNESCO World Heritage Site that showcases the rich arts and cultural history of Salzburg. This expansive Baroque complex includes a cathedral, an Abbey, and five separate museums. One of the museums, the famous Dom Museum, houses the Kunst und Wunderkammer, which features a fascinating collection of stuffed animals, fossils, scientific devices, and rock crystal grinding works.

sources.snippet: A visit to Salzburg Cathedral is certainly one of the things to do in Salzburg because this building is absolutely impressive from the inside as well as from the outside. The imposing church dates back to the early Baroque period and shapes the cityscape of Salzburg with its mighty dome and towers. The cathedral square is also the site of the annual Christmas market in winter and the famous Salzburg Festival in summer.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Salzburg (Austria)

sources.snippet: A UNESCO World Heritage site, DomQuartier Salzburg is a stunning attraction made up of a complex of baroque buildings built around three courtyards. It was created by the prince-archbishops of Salzburg more than 400 years ago. Originally it contained both their residential quarters and a Cathedral, as an expression of their claim to rule both the heavens and the earth.
sources.shortName: 17 BEST Places to See & Things to Do in Salzburg, Austria (+Map & Tips)

sources.snippet: The Domquartier is a museum complex and a cultural highlight on a Salzburg city trip. You follow a predetermined path which leads you through the following areas:
sources.shortName: Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

places.name: DomQuartier Salzburg

reviews.text:
One of the best places to visit in Salzburg.
We spent a good couple of hours here.
Beautiful chandlers , painting, jewled items.
Curiosity cupboards.
Love the architecture.
The rooms are very big .
We used our Salzburg cards.

Basically a bunch of museums put together, you have the one connected to Salzburg Cathedral, residence gallery, state rooms and the museum of St Peter.

You can also get a better view on the fountain and the center in general while going though the tour.

Beatiful museum but the reason for the 2 stars is that they put contemporary art in the middle of multiple rooms which really harm the atmosphere of the particular rooms. Contemporary art should stay in the contemporary museum in my opinion where it's setting alings with other pieces. This mishmash was really saddening.

Visited on 9th December and this is probably the best value experience we have found over the last 9 months of travelling. The inclusion of historical palatial buildings, significant artwork, items of significance from the church, access to view the historical church from the upper level adjacent to the pipe organ, and some museum collections.
It is all very well maintained, pristine and tidy. There are also several locations where you have views over the marketplace where the Christmas Stalls are situated.
You could easily spend two hours or more reviewing it all.

places.generalDescription: Hotel Goldener Hirsch, a Luxury Collection Hotel in Salzburg, is an elegant establishment housed in a centuries-old inn. The hotel offers two refined restaurants and a rustic bar. It has been welcoming guests for over 600 years and exudes the style of an Austrian countryside manor with its white walls, exposed brick, and signature gold stag motif. The seventy guestrooms are individually styled with many featuring antique furnishings for an elegant ambiance.

sources.snippet:
This ancient though luxurious hotel oozes history, offering sophisticated service in a traditional Austrian setting. Authentic antiques, delicious cuisine and a cosy ambience make this the top choice for a luxury stay in Salzburg. from 
$252
for 1 room, 1 nightincluding taxes & fees
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Salzburg, Austria (2025)

places.name: Hotel Goldener Hirsch, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Salzburg

reviews.text: Our first trip to Salzburg was made even more special by the incredible hospitality and beautiful room at the Hotel Goldener Hirsch.  The staff were possibly the best, most genuinely warm and gracious of any hotel we have stayed at.  The decor is traditional Austrian with a luxurious bent.  Our room had all of the amenities we needed to settle in and relax (including AC!).  You feel comfortable and home immediately.  Throughout our stay, from check-in, until check-out we felt so well-cared for by everyone in the hotel.  Our dinner in the restaurant was exquisite and delicious.  It was a joy to stay here, and we will definitely return on our next trip to Salzburg.

Oh my gosh, what a magnificent place this is! This hotel has been around for centuries, and it oozes history in every pore. We were upgraded to a lovely suite. The staff was very open and friendly, and we had no problem communicating with one another one would expect in most German speaking countries.  They even put up with my bad German. Our breakfast was tremendous, and I can't complain about a single thing during our visit. If you love good service and a good hotel in the absolute heart of town this is the place for you.

We recently stayed 3 nights in the King One Bedroom Suite. The details and decor of this hotel are unmatched. The traditional Austrian touches add to the charm of being in the heart of the Altstadt. We ate breakfast every morning in the hotel and loved the variety and service. While lacking in certain amenities; sauna, gym, etc, the hotel lends to a bygone era of service and class.

places.generalDescription: St. Peter Stiftskulinarium is a renowned restaurant that boasts being one of the oldest in Europe, with historical records dating back to 803 A.D. It was established by Benedictine monks and is steeped in history, with tales of famous figures such as Charlemagne and Columbus having dined or drank there. The restaurant offers an elegant ambiance and serves creative dishes and drinks, blending traditional Austrian standards with international specialties.

sources.snippet: End the day with a romantic dinner at Restaurant Ikarus, located at the Red Bull Hangar-7 and featuring innovative cuisine by top chefs from around the world.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria
Salzburg for Lovers : Magazine
Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

places.name: St. Peter Stiftskulinarium

reviews.text: We had a truly beautiful experience at this restaurant. The ambiance was unique and inviting, creating the perfect setting for a relaxing meal. The atmosphere stood out with its charming design and calming vibe. What made the evening even more special was the outstanding service from Waiter Cesar. He was incredibly helpful, kind, and attentive, offering excellent recommendations that turned out to be absolutely delicious. Thanks to him, we enjoyed a perfectly curated meal. Highly recommended for both the atmosphere and the impeccable service.

Food was nothing to shout about. Beautiful presentation but the taste is mediocre. Stunning environment and even more stunning interior! Wish the person serving us could do better? He's absolutely gentleman, don't get me wrong, but‚Ä¶ we ordered asparagus for starters, he should've recommended something else without asparagus when we picked our mains? Who likes to have repeated ingredients when we can try them all?

Nockerl was fluffy, warm but too sweet. Perhaps it's just the way this dessert is rather than the way this place prepares it.

I'd still recommend coming here but it's really expensive‚Ä¶ ‚Ç¨40 just for baby veal with asparagus‚Ä¶

This was the best meal that I have had in Austria so far! It was incredible! From the atmosphere and being in the oldest restaurant in Central Europe, operating since 803 to the amazing dishes and great vibes, couldn't ask for a better experience. Would highly recommend and it is a must! The grilled octopus and the duck were incredible and were very well balanced. We will be back!

places.generalDescription: Marko-Feingold-Steg is a bridge in Salzburg that pays tribute to Marko Feingold, offering a serene walkway connecting the Old Town with Mulln across the Salzach River. Surrounded by historic landmarks like Hohensalzburg Fortress and Mirabell Palace, it provides picturesque views and a peaceful atmosphere. The bridge is known for its vibrant surroundings during the day and charmingly lit appearance at night, especially during Christmas.

sources.snippet: Marko-Feingold-Steg‚Äîthe bridge of love locks‚Äîwill come into view, and if you didn‚Äôt bring a padlock to declare your undying affection, don‚Äôt worry. You can always mentally lock your love; after all, the sentiment is what counts, right?. (Besides, some of us are already padlocked to our phones, so we might as well spread the love around.)
sources.shortName: Romantic Escapes in Salzburg, Austria
Salzburg for Lovers : Magazine

places.name: Marko-Feingold-Steg

reviews.text: This is such a romantic part of Salzburg. Plan ahead to put your love lock on the bridge and make a wish. The bridge can get extremely busy. Try to go early. A walk along the river is a must if you want to experience the picturesque Salzburg houses and have a breather from all the tourists. Popular spot for great musicians to share their talent.

One of the best cities I've ever visited is Salzburg. I lived there for 7 months and completely fell in love with it. The city is full of music, amazing food, and kind, welcoming people. Here I am at the famous Marko-Feingold-Steg Love Lock Bridge such a beautiful spot.

A very beautiful bridge , with lots and lots of pad locks withe all kind of couple's name on it ., you have a very beautiful view of the fort and the river from this bridge , you can also get down to the river bank and spend sometime soaking your tired feet in the ice cold water

places.generalDescription: Caf√© Bazar is an iconic coffeehouse located in the Liefering district of Salzburg, offering a charming space with a terrace where guests can enjoy traditional dishes, drinks, and desserts. Hosted by Evelyn Brandstatter and her enthusiastic team, the caf√© boasts a perfect synergy with Restaurant Brandstatter, known for its award-winning cuisine.

sources.snippet: And in Salzburg it is probably best to drink it in the historic Caf√© Bazar. Celebrities such as Marlene Dietrich, Romy Schneider and Tomas Mann have been guests here.
sources.shortName: Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

places.name: Caf√© Bazar

reviews.text: Absolutely gorgeous cafe. On a warm and sunny late morning, I sat here and watched passerby's walk along the river while enjoying a wonderful cappuccino and omelette. The ingredients are very fresh, the service is very kind, and the atmosphere is classy and pleasant.

It is a cafe with prices a little bit on the higher side. However, once you enter the cafe it feels like you are in the old style Viennese coffee houses.
The waiters are busy but they are very nice and polite.
Service is fast. Coffee is good. The desserts are great. We had a chocolate mousse which was very nice. For me the highlight was apfelstrudel with vanilla sauce. It was the best I have had in a long time in Austria. It was very fresh, and flaky and the vanilla sauce was mild, light and complicated the strudel very well.

super classical vibe, amazing service that's very friendly and understanding to the point of having an english menu too.
food was great and coffee was even better.
definitely worth a stop just to take it in

places.generalDescription: Salzach River offers a variety of experiences for visitors to Salzburg. One option is to take a cruise along the river, with different tour lengths available, providing stunning views of the city and surrounding alps. Another way to enjoy the river is by taking a leisurely stroll along its banks, offering picturesque vistas and photo opportunities of the city skyline and Hohensalzburg fortress. The northern point near Mirabell Gardens provides an especially beautiful view at sunset or in the early morning.

sources.snippet: Unfurling from city to meadow and mountain, the banks of the Salzach River are a joy to cycle, especially when the city heaves in summer. Grab yourself a rental bike and pedal south, with views of the Altstadt‚Äôs riot of domes and spires slowly fading as you pass the Volksgarten park. Going for a pedal here allows you to give the city crowds the slip for a spell.
sources.shortName: The 12 best things to do in Salzburg
Salzburg for Lovers : Magazine
Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

places.name: Salzach

reviews.text:
Great place. You can go for a morning / evening walk across the river. You can go for cycling as well!!
It has a park for children.
You would have one of the best views from here.
Wonderful place for all age groups.
This beautiful river runs through the heart of Salzburg. The landscaping on both sides is amazing. It also divides old and new towns. It's worth walking along the banks in the morning or evening.

The Salzach river runs through the centre of the township, with the Alps as an amazing background. The ‚Äòold city' comprises original medieval and baroque buildings (on the left bank), looking across to the 19th century ‚Äònew city' (right bank).

places.generalDescription: Cozy, relaxed rooms in a quaint hotel offering a restaurant & complimentary parking.

sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Salzburg, Austria (2025)

places.name: Pension Bloberger Hof

reviews.text:
We loved everything about this hotel!

The room was clean and beautiful. The beds were extremely comfortable.

The hotel was dog friendly , although we kept our dog in the room for breakfast and dinner upon request which we were happy with.

The view from our room was spectacular and a lovely way to wake up each day.

The breakfast was excellent and couldn't wish for a better start to the morning. There was a wide selection. I believe the dining room has been recently renovated and it was beautiful.

We ate dinner at the hotel and it was such a very tasty and relaxing experience that we chose to return the following evening for dinner also. We would recommend a price list for daily specials.

We would love to return to the hotel again in a different season. We imagine it would also be a great experience.

The bus stop is 2 minutes walk and it is around 15-20 minutes to get to the centre of Salzburg. Around 40 minutes to the HBF with one bus change. We also bought a 24hr bus ticket from the hotel reception.

The family owners are very friendly. Thank you.

Our stay at Pension Blobergerhof was absolutely wonderful from beginning to end. Located in a peaceful, scenic area just outside the city, this charming family-owned guesthouse offered everything we hoped for and more.

The rooms were clean, spacious, and very comfortable, with beautiful mountain views from the balcony. We loved relaxing by the lovely pool.

A real highlight of our stay was having access to bikes. Riding through the forests and quiet country paths to the palace was one of our favorite activities.

The breakfasts were fresh and delicious, with a great variety of choices, and the dinner we had was some of the best food we had in Austria.

The bus stop is just a short walk from the pension, making it very easy to get to the center of Salzburg.

We were sad to go when our stay ended, and hope to return someday soon.

Beautiful building, with what looks like a recently renovated breakfast room. The room itself was massive, with a nice bathroom and the view from our window was perfect!

The staff are so friendly, you can pay at reception for daily bus tickets into Salzburg, which was really easy and only took 15 minutes to get into the centre.

Breakfast was delicious and a really good thorough spread with plenty of options for vegetarians too.

The room was a little hot but it's been exceptionally hot in Austria all week, so not the fault of the hotel.

Can't rate highly enough, will definitely be coming back! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

places.address: Pension Bloberger Hof ***, Hammerauer Str. 4, 5020 Salzburg, Austria

places.generalDescription: Hotel Rosenvilla offers a contemporary and relaxed lodging experience, with a laid-back restaurant and furnished patio. Nestled among gardens in the exclusive residential district of Aigen, it's just a short walk from Salzburg's historic city center. The hotel provides tastefully furnished rooms with luxurious bathrooms, some featuring four-poster beds and wooden floors. Free WiFi is available in public areas and most units.

sources.snippet: A traditional flower clad building with contemporary interiors. Romantic rooms and suites have four poster beds, lots of natural light, wooden floors and all the mod cons. Fabulous breakfast room and garden.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Salzburg, Austria (2025)

places.name: Hotel Rosenvilla

reviews.text: This hotel gives a warm welkom. The room is tip top. The people are so kind and helpful. The breakfast buffet: It just didn't end. Compliments to you all. You have made my stay in Salzburg magnificent!

We stayed for 3 nights in a first floor room with balcony.

Staff very pleasant and friendly, always welcoming and the hotel is open to 9:30 after which you use your key to get in.

Bed was comfy, I love the Austrian 2x single duvet option on a double bed, it's ingenious. Slept well in comfort (caveat - I travel with facemask and earplugs) Room was spacious. The bathroom has a toilet separated with a slide door from the rest of the bathroom rather than an all in one like you can see sometimes. Shower had good pressure and pleasant temperature. We didn't use the balcony much due to the weather but it would be nice in the evening in a warmer evening with a couple of chairs, lounger and shade. The room also had a couple of reading chairs and a desk to offer flexibility and a good size TV in line with the bed.

Staff really have attention to detail, we got some wine from a supermarket when out and left it in the room and they brought us glasses without asking.

The bath had a jacuzzi option but we didn't use it.

My only negative thoughts on the room:

I would suggest to the hotel that a bar or non-slip mat might be useful as you're stepping out the bath onto a tiled floor and only have the towel rail on your left or the bath to grab if you do wobble as the only other option is the glass splash protector

Options on pillows would be useful (maybe a question on booking?) - we didn't ask so maybe it was an option but I like a firm pillow, the 2 provided were pretty soft and floppy

I would like a kettle in the room but the machine downstairs is always available - just means you have to get showered or at least dressed to get any, I prefer to get out of bed and have some coffee before going down.

Breakfast

Plenty of options - bread and bagels, cakes and sweets plus cold meats, cheese etc + fruit, freshly poured smoothie and juice, cereals. We had maybe 20 minutes each day there, taking time and enjoying the food

There was only one coffee machine but breakfast was never that busy when we were there so wasn't a major issue

My only complaints were that there was no hot buffet, only the offer of eggs (which I don't like) - some sausage or bacon to be offered, would be something to consider?

Hotel is incredibly easy to get to on the bus from the station (160 I think), about 10 stops, free if you get the Salzburg card which I would recommend anyway due to the free access to so many things

The room had a low ceiling and I banged my head three times but the room itself was beautiful. This is why 5 stars for the room. The staff are amazing and make you feel at home. It's a boutique hotel, not a large scale commercial operation. You can help yourself to coffee and tea anytime of the day and sit in their courtyard to relax. It is about 20 minutes walk from the tourist areas but there is also local bus available. I would stay here again.

places.generalDescription: Jazzit is a late-night venue in Salzburg that offers live jazz performances and shows suitable for kids. The city also boasts other entertainment options such as rock houses, festivals, gin bars, cocktail bars, beer gardens, wine taverns, Irish pubs, and discos. Art lovers can enjoy numerous art galleries with diverse programs featuring established and emerging artists.

sources.snippet: Jazzit, Salzburg‚Äôs most legendary music venue, is a fantastic place for a night out and it also offers many free gigs. The club hosts regular ‚Äòelectro swing‚Äô parties as well as various blues and jazz concerts that showcase local and international talent. Furthermore, the outdoor garden and the bar‚Äîboth available to enter without purchasing a ticket‚Äîis a nice to relax and have a drink or two.
sources.shortName: 11 Free And Cheap Date Ideas To Try In Salzburg

places.name: Jazzit

reviews.text: One of my favourite JazzClub in Europe

I visited Jazzit for a clubbing night, and unfortunately, my experience was disappointing. The venue presents itself as an inclusive space, mindful of important social issues, and at first, the atmosphere seemed positive. However, the way I was treated by the staff was completely unacceptable.

After paying ‚Ç¨20 for entry, I was on the dance floor when I made eye contact with a girl who seemed a bit serious. In a totally normal and respectful way, I lightly touched her shoulder and asked if she was okay. Anyone with some clubbing experience knows that interactions like this are part of a normal, social night out.

A few minutes later, as I was moving to another room, two staff members approached me and told me not to touch people, implying that several different people had complained about my behavior. This happened without them talking to me first, without knowing what had actually occurred, and without giving me a chance to explain myself.

I felt discriminated against and humiliated, and my night was completely ruined. I decided to leave after only an hour and a half.

What struck me the most was how quickly they judged me. I wonder if I would have been treated the same way if I weren't a foreigner. I had the clear impression that the staff acted with prejudice, making assumptions about me without any effort to hear my side of the story.

It's ironic that a club that claims to be modern and inclusive has such a rigid and unfair approach, passing judgment without dialogue. If inclusion means feeling watched and treated like a problem for a completely respectful interaction, then something is seriously wrong.

Tl;dr - Go for the jazz, not the drinks or atmosphere. I saw an amazing live jazz act (Emmeluth's Amoeba) and was absolutely blown away by the talent on display and the quality of the sound. However, I found the atmosphere a little sterile and serious for jazz (lecture-style seating, dead silent audience) and my negroni was passable at best. With a little more attention to ambience and drinks, Jazzit could easily get the fifth star!

places.generalDescription: Friedhof St. Peter, also known as Petersfriedhof, is a charming cemetery in Salzburg with a rich history dating back to before 700 AD. The graveyard is adorned with baroque tombs of nobility and features 12th-century catacombs and chapels carved into the rock face. Notable graves include those of Wolfgang's sister Nannerl and his childhood friend Michael Haydn. The cemetery, surrounded by the Church of St.

sources.snippet: Right next to the cable car at the foot of the fortress mountain you will find the somewhat hidden and inconspicuous entrance to Petersfriedhof.
sources.shortName: Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

places.name: Friedhof St. Peter (Petersfriedhof)

reviews.text:
Friedhof St. Peter is a peaceful and historic cemetery in downtown square of Salzburg. The ornate baroque tombstones and the cliffside catacombs create a unique and striking atmosphere. Walking through, you can't help but feel the weight of its history.

Inside the nearby church, I lit a candle for a loved one who was very ill. It was a quiet and beautiful moment, made even more special because we used to watch ‚ÄúThe Sound of Music‚Äù together. Being in a place so connected to the film added a layer of meaning to the experience.

This spot is serene and reflective, perfect for appreciating Salzburg's rich past or finding a moment of connection and peace. It's a visit I'll always hold close to my heart :)

St. Peter's Cemetery in Salzburg is a peaceful and picturesque spot nestled at the foot of the Festungsberg. The well-maintained grounds feature ornate wrought-iron crosses, colorful flowers, and shaded pathways, creating a serene atmosphere that's perfect for a quiet stroll. The surrounding architecture adds to the charm, with the nearby church and rock-carved catacombs enhancing the unique setting. It's a lovely place to pause and appreciate the tranquil side of Salzburg's Old Town.

A peaceful and beautiful cemetery. We enjoyed the calm atmosphere and admiring the differences between this and cemeteries in the US, and appreciated how this felt more like a celebration of life and reunion of families after death. The area was very well maintained and not too crowded.

places.generalDescription: M√∂nchsberg, also known as Monks Hill, is a rocky plateau above Salzburg offering stunning views of the old town and the Alps. This wooded ridge features meadows, castles, and a modern art museum that can be reached by a lift. The area is home to notable attractions such as the Benedictine Abbey of St. Peter with buildings dating back to the 17th and 18th centuries, including a church remodeled in Rococo style.

sources.snippet: With its vaulted taverns and vast, 1400-seat beer garden set up under the shade of chestnut trees, this monk-founded brewery at the foot of M√∂nchsberg has given Salzburg rollicking good times since 1621. Fill your tankard at the foyer pump and visit the Schmankerlgang (deli stands) for hearty, beer-swigging grub like Stelze (ham hock), pork belly, and pretzels as big as your head. Beers swing from mildly hoppy lagers to amber-hued wheat beers.
sources.shortName: The 12 best things to do in Salzburg

sources.snippet: The spectacular Hohensalzburg Fortress is one of the main landmarks of Salzburg and also the heart of the historic old town. A visit to this stunning place is an absolute highlight and definitely this impressive fortress is one of the most beautiful attractions in Salzburg. The 900-year-old Hohensalzburg Fortress is located at the top of the M√∂nchsberg and can either be climbed on foot, or you can comfortably take the fortress train, which is located next to the Stieglkeller and the Festungsgasse.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Salzburg (Austria)

sources.snippet: Another place from which to enjoy exceptional city views in Salzburg is at the top of M√∂nchsberg hill. You can reach the viewing platform ‚Äì also known as Winkler Terrace ‚Äì by taking a short elevator ride from Gst√§ttengasse street, near the river. The cost of the ride is also included in the Salzburg Card.
sources.shortName: 17 BEST Places to See & Things to Do in Salzburg, Austria (+Map & Tips)

sources.snippet: The M√∂nchsberg dominates the cityscape because it is located in the middle of the old town and stretches about 1.7 km through Salzburg. From up here you have a perfect view over the whole of Salzburg and its surroundings from many vantage points.
sources.shortName: Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

sources.snippet: On the northern part of the M√∂nchsberg, between the Augustiner Br√§u brewery and Museum der Moderne art museum, awaits picturesque meadows & vistas of the city.
sources.siteName: 4* Hotel Wolf-Dietrich in Salzburg, Austria, Old Town
sources.shortName: Romantic hotel Salzburg | romantic city break for 2
Salzburg for Lovers : Magazine

places.name: M√∂nchsberg

reviews.text: We visited the modern museum and were pleasantly surprised by the lovely views and forest walkways. You can even take your dog for a walk here. Nice castle view and interesting architectural construction where you can exercise your vocal cords and hear it echo.

M√∂nchsberg @ Salzburg üåøüá¶üáπ
üìç Salzburg Old Town

M√∂nchsberg is a scenic hill and green parkland stretching along the western edge of Salzburg's Old Town, offering some of the best elevated views over the city. The walking trail runs along the historic defence wall and is dotted with viewpoints, small gates, and cultural landmarks.

I explored M√∂nchsberg as part of my hike down from Fortress Hohensalzburg, first passing the Museum der Moderne Salzburg, then crossing Schartentor before reaching Humboldtterrasse. From here, panoramic vistas unfolded-the red and grey rooftops of the Altstadt, the green domes of Salzburg Cathedral, the Salzach River winding through town, and the Alps beyond.

It was surprisingly quiet along the trail, with only a few locals enjoying the park and the view, making the walk feel peaceful and unhurried. Eventually, I continued to Klausentor, took a short break at Caf√© am Kai, crossed M√ºllnersteg footbridge, and returned to Mirabell Palace.

üß≠ Tip: This is one of Salzburg's best free activities. Come in the late afternoon for softer light and fewer people. Wear comfortable shoes-the trail is easy but involves some inclines and steps.
Either you go with Festungbahn (cable car) or by foot through stair, that's fine. The best place to see sunset in Salzburg you'll agree when you see it yourself.

places.generalDescription: Salzburg Airport is the main gateway for domestic and international flights, conveniently connecting travelers to the city and nearby ski areas. Visitors from EEA or Swiss countries can live in Salzburg without a visa, while non-EEA expatriates can apply for a Red-White-Red card for settlement. The charming city of Salzburg offers a compact, walkable historic center with rich cultural experiences and breathtaking mountain views.

sources.snippet: The best way to get to Salzburg, Austria by plane is to fly into Salzburg Airport (SZG). There are several airlines that offer direct flights to Salzburg from major European cities.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

places.name: Salzburg Airport

reviews.text:
Beautifully airport with snow topped mountains in the distance.
Small but well functioning airport.
Very friendly staff.
Fun to see some in carnival costumes today.
The Little bee was very friendly üêù
Food & drinks a bit expensive.
Quick boarding. Very professional staff.
They were filming in the sunglasses department not sure who the lady was but people seemed very interested in her.
Lovely airport to fly to & from

Airport Salzburg is a small nice Airport. You get easily an oversight. It has 2 terminals, while Terminal 2 (Amadeus) is just in winter active. Its a very safe place and there are also small bistro where you can grab some food and drinks.

A small airport surrounded by stunning mountain views, offering a peaceful and convenient travel experience. The basic facilities are well-maintained, and there's a small duty-free shop for last-minute purchases. Clean and tidy restrooms add to the comfort of the journey.

My only concern was the lack of a water refill station. While bottled water is available for purchase, I would have appreciated a place to refill my own bottle.
